intro: Albovia, commonly known as the white violets, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pale purple. They are native to various regions in the Americas and are often found in moist, woodland environments. Albovia species are perennial herbs with lance-shaped leaves and produce small, clustered blooms. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded garden settings.
